docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Thursday, Oct. 4 (UP)--Gen. Benjamin Menendez, retired, has been sentenced to fifteen years in prison for leading the abortive revolt against the Peron Government last Friday, it was reported reliably today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Thursday, Oct. 4 (UP)--Gen. Benjamin Menendez, retired, has been sentenced to fifteen years in prison for leading the abortive revolt against the Peron Government last Friday, it was reported reliably today.

docs.snippet: OTTAWA, Oct. 3 (Canadian Press)--The Canadian Government, has decided to step up emergency allocations of newsprint to help countries in "special need," it was learned today.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 4--The relatively mild sentence of dismissal from the army and fifteen years imprisonment for Gen. Benjamin Menendez, retired, leader of last week's abortive revolt, was approved today by President Juan D. Peron. Seven other army...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 4--The relatively mild sentence of dismissal from the army and fifteen years imprisonment for Gen. Benjamin Menendez, retired, leader of last week's abortive revolt, was approved today by President Juan D. Peron. Seven other army officers were sentenced to three to six years and dismissal.
